definitions.definition: at an equal distance from the extremities of something; central.
examples: the early and middle part of life

definitions.definition: (of a member of a group, series, or sequence) so placed as to have the same number of members on each side.
examples: the woman was in her middle forties

definitions.definition: intermediate in rank, quality, or ability.
examples: there is a dearth of talent at the middle level

definitions.definition: (of a language) of the period between the old and modern forms.
denoting a voice of verbs in some languages, such as Greek, that expresses reciprocal or reflexive action.
denoting a transitive or intransitive verb in English with a passive sense, e.g., cuts in this meat cuts well.
the point or position at an equal distance from the sides, edges, or ends of something.
examples: she stood alone in the middle of the street

definitions.definition: the point at or around the center of a process or activity, period of time, etc.
examples: we were married in the middle of December
synonyms: kernel "a shallow dish with a spike in the middle"

definitions.definition: a person's waist or waist and stomach.
examples: he had a towel around his middle
synonyms: gut "he had a towel around his middle"

definitions.definition: the form or voice of a verb expressing reflexive or reciprocal action, or a passive sense for a transitive or intransitive verb.
